title: Is FontMarketplace Hastings an original font or a rip-off?
content:
FontMarketplace is selling this font as Hastings. Is that the real name or is this a rip-off?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424142847im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hastings_5059.jpg)
author: Renaissance Man

comments.content:
Hi Steve,  
I don’t know. All I can contribute is that there’s [Stiletto](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424142847/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/stiletto/) by URW++ (Designer: Ralph M. Unger) – that looks very similar. And then there’s [Adieu](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424142847/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bergsland/adieu/) by David Bergsland; also quite close. He claims that “Adieu is an old-fashioned display font traced and modified from a group of Victorian fonts.”

F
Wow, you are good, Florian. I couldn't believe Hastings was an original. Thanks!
Don’t praise me, praise Kevin Woodward, the inventor of the mighty [WhatTheFont](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424142847/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/) online font recognition service! ;°)

Per URW: "Stiletto was designed for the URW++ FontForum." & "Design date: 2006"

Right ... This appears in two predigital catalogs as Chevalier, with the 1980 VGC Typositor catalog marking it as a VGC original (but that was sometimes misleading).
